Sentencas: Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCs) can operate with carbonaceous fuels.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells fueled by carbonaceous fuels: A thermodynamics-based approach for safe operation and experimental validation

Sentencas: However, experiments indicate possible carbon deposition or coking on Ni-based anodes.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells fueled by carbonaceous fuels: A thermodynamics-based approach for safe operation and experimental validation

Sentencas: Thermodynamic equilibrium calculations with NASA computer program CEA (Chemical Equilibrium with Applications) for typical SOFC operating temperatures predict graphitic carbon (C(gr)) formation.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells fueled by carbonaceous fuels: A thermodynamics-based approach for safe operation and experimental validation

Sentencas: While fuel humidification eliminates coking, excess steam degrades Ni-based anode, necessitating suitable steam supply for safe operation.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells fueled by carbonaceous fuels: A thermodynamics-based approach for safe operation and experimental validation

Sentencas: Thermodynamic approach is validated using experiments on 25 mm diameter electrolyte-supported NextCell-HP SOFC button cell fueled by H-2 and simulated syngas (CO and H-2).
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells fueled by carbonaceous fuels: A thermodynamics-based approach for safe operation and experimental validation

Sentencas: The use of 1 SLPM H-2 (fuel) with 4 SLPM air (oxidant) provides peak power density of similar to 1000 mW cm(-2).
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells fueled by carbonaceous fuels: A thermodynamics-based approach for safe operation and experimental validation

Sentencas: With simulated syngas fuel, cell performance drops.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells fueled by carbonaceous fuels: A thermodynamics-based approach for safe operation and experimental validation

Sentencas: In-situ diagnosis with steam supply to anode suggests carbon deposition based on detection of H-2 and CO in tail gas.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells fueled by carbonaceous fuels: A thermodynamics-based approach for safe operation and experimental validation

Sentencas: Equilibrium analysis suggests carbon-free operation by humidifying simulated syngas (CO:H-2 = 1:3 molar ratio) with similar to 5% steam by volume, at 973 K and above.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells fueled by carbonaceous fuels: A thermodynamics-based approach for safe operation and experimental validation

Sentencas: Further experiments are conducted on a fresh cell.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells fueled by carbonaceous fuels: A thermodynamics-based approach for safe operation and experimental validation

Sentencas: Simulated syngas (CO:H-2 = 1:3 volumetric ratio) with similar to 5% steam by volume provides safe cell operation.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells fueled by carbonaceous fuels: A thermodynamics-based approach for safe operation and experimental validation

Sentencas: The study provides a pathway to safely utilize carbonaceous fuels in SOFC by suitable humidification, coupling thermodynamic analyses and experiments.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells fueled by carbonaceous fuels: A thermodynamics-based approach for safe operation and experimental validation
